intro: Myrsine fusca var. fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered myrsine, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually arranged in clusters along the stems. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round berries. This variant is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky outcrops.
